title: Bayern Munich 3-2 St Pauli: Michael Olise and Leroy Sane star as hosts go six points clear in Bundesliga
title_page: Bayern Munich 3-2 St Pauli: Michael Olise and Leroy Sane star as hosts go six points clear in Bundesliga - BBC Sport
maintext:
Leroy Sane scored twice as Bayern Munich went six points clear at the top of the Bundesliga with victory over St Pauli.
England captain Harry Kane opened the scoring by sweeping home from Michael Olise's cross for his 22nd league goal of the campaign.
Elias Saad equalised for St Pauli 10 minutes later, ghosting past the Bayern defence and finishing into the bottom corner from close range.
Olise provided his second assist of the game with a sublime ball over the top, which Sane controlled before firing past St Pauli goalkeeper Nikola Vasilj.
Sane produced a calm finish for his second from Kane's low cross into the box.
St Pauli provided a late scare deep into stoppage time when Lars Ritzka struck low and hard into the bottom corner from the edge of the area, but it proved to be a mere consolation.
The result means Bayern remain on course for a record-extending 34th German title with defending champions Bayer Leverkusen in second place.
Vincent Kompany's side suffered significant defensive setbacks during the international break, with Canada captain Alphonso Davies ruled out for the rest of the season due to a cruciate ligament injury sustained against the United States.
Centre-back Dayot Upamecano is also sidelined after sustaining a knee injury on international duty with France, as Les Blues beat Croatia to reach the semi-finals of the Nations League.
